arm_group.description: Opening wedge high tibial osteotomy using Puddu plate
Closing wedge high tibial osteotomy using cramp fixation

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective randomized study. Compare two techniques for high tibial osteotomy (HTO) for
      treatment of medial knee osteoarthritis.

      Opening wedge osteotomy using Puddu plate vs Closing wedge osteotomy using cramp fixation.
      We will compare functional results and patient satisfaction with repetitive evaluations from
      preoperatively to 2 years postoperatively.

clinical_study.brief_title: Time-dependent Functional Results Following HTO. Closing Wedge vs Opening Wedge Technique.

detailed_description.textblock:
Determination of the time course of patient-relevant functional outcome and the time course
      of Range of Motion (ROM) following HTO. Comparison of the Opening wedge and Closing wedge
      methods.

      Time-dependent improvement in functional outcome following High tibial Osteotomy. Medial
      opening wedge vs Lateral closing wedge. A two-year prospective randomized study involving 70
      patients.

      In a prospective randomized study, we plan to include 70 patients aged 30-60 years operated
      with valgus high tibial osteotomy. 2 groups: 35 opening wedge, and 35 closing wedge
      osteotomies. Data are collected by independent investigators (physiotherapists)
      preoperatively and at 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, and 2 years postoperatively. Knee injury
      and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) and ROM are determined at all follow-ups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Medial osteoarthritis in the knee (x-ray and arthroscopy)

          -  Pain in medial compartment of the knee

          -  Correction angle of 5 degrees or more

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Former or active infection in the knee

          -  Rheumatoid arthritis or other similar disease

          -  Cancer

          -  Neurological disease

          -  Kidney disease or metabolic disease

clinical_study.official_title: Time-dependent Functional Results Following HTO. Closing Wedge vs Opening Wedge Technique.

other_outcome.description: The change in Oxford score are followed at several time points the first 2 years. Patients will be evaluated with Oxford knee score, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.
The change in Lysholm score are followed at several time points the first 2 years. Patients will be evaluated with Lysholm, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.
The change in UCLA scale are followed at several time points the first 2 years. Patients will be evaluated with UCLA activity scale, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.
The change in Tegner score are followed at several time points the first 2 years. Patients will be evaluated with Tegner score, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: The change in KOOS score are followed at several time points the first 2 years. Patients will be evaluated with KOOS, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.
primary_outcome.measure: Kne injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The change in ROM are followed at several time points the first 2 years. ROM will be measured 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
